title: 108_hr195
content: The "Informed Choice Act" may be cited as the Act. Grants are provided for the purchase of ultrasound equipment. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may grant funds for ultrasound equipment to nonprofit organizations providing free ultrasound examinations to pregnant women under medical supervision. Eligibility requires IRS approval as a tax-exempt entity and operation as a community-based pregnancy help clinic. Services must be provided under physician guidance. The entity must be under the supervision of a licensed physician and comply with all legal requirements to provide medical services to pregnant women. Each pregnant woman must be shown the ultrasound image of the fetus and given a description of its characteristics. Each pregnant woman must be given the approximate age of the embryo or fetus based on medical judgment. They should also receive information on abortion alternatives, childbirth, adoption, and available assistance from public and private agencies. The entity receiving a grant must maintain medical malpractice insurance of at least $1,000,000 for activities related to the ultrasound machine purchased with the grant. The grant amount cannot exceed 50% of the ultrasound machine's purchase price or $20,000, whichever is less. Grants are subject to the entity not receiving more than 30% of its revenue from a single source or donor. Applications for grants must be submitted to the Secretary in the specified form and manner. The Secretary determines necessary agreements, assurances, and information for grant applications. Applicants must report annually on compliance with eligibility conditions. "Community based pregnancy help medical clinic" provides free services under licensed physician supervision. The Secretary of Health and Human Services authorizes appropriations for a community-based pregnancy help medical clinic that provides free services under licensed physician supervision. $3,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2003, with additional funding for fiscal years 2004 through 2006.
